intro: Inga cochleata, commonly known as the "cupuaçu" tree, is a tropical plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It is a leguminous species belonging to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and showy, butterfly-shaped flowers. The plant produces large, edible fruits that are rich in nutrients, including high levels of antioxidants and healthy fats. Its roots have nitrogen-fixing capabilities, contributing to soil fertility in its native habitat. Inga cochleata is also valued for its ornamental appeal and potential economic importance in sustainable agriculture.
